nodes.name: get_cases
nodes.lql: runAction(_Start_Node, "logichub.case_management", 40, "fetch_cases_v2", {"__lh_action_timeout_sec": "", "case_management_case_search_query": "Palo Alto Threat Activity in the last 24 hours", "__lh_rows_to_process": "", "case_management_case_limit": "", "case_management_time_between_consecutive_requests_milliseconds": "", "case_management_explode_flag": "True", "__lh_multithread_count": ""})
nodes.description: Search Issues (Requires minimum logichub version M59.)

data.case_management_case_search_query: Palo Alto Threat Activity in the last 24 hours

nodes.title: get cases

nodes.name: SQL_operation
nodes.lql: `select *, regexp_extract(title, "Palo Alto Threat Activity from '(.*?)' in the last 24 hours") as src_ip, regexp_extract(id,"cyber-(.*)") as id_num from Get_ID_and_Title`
nodes.title: SQL_operation

nodes.name: first_opened_as_parent
nodes.lql: `select *, row_number() over (partition by src_ip order by id_num asc) as row_num from SQL_operation`
nodes.title: group node

nodes.name: first_opened_as_parentChild1
nodes.lql: `select id as pid, src_ip from first_opened_as_parent where row_num=1`

nodes.name: Get_ID_and_Title
nodes.lql: `select get_json_object(\`result\`, '$.id') as id, get_json_object(\`result\`, '$.title') as title, get_json_object(result,"$.status") as status, get_json_object(result,'$.descriptionRaw') as summary from get_cases`
nodes.title: Get ID and Title

nodes.name: first_opened_as_parentChild2
nodes.lql: `select id as cid, src_ip, status, summary from first_opened_as_parent where row_num>1 and status not like 'Closed'`

nodes.name: filter_for_child_cases
nodes.lql: `select *, "admin" as reporter from first_opened_as_parentChild1Child1 where cid is not null`

descriptor.name: Case Management
descriptor.description: An Integration to manage LogicHub Cases. It can create new cases, get all cases, get a specific case's details and update or delete a case.

steps.name: Case Management Authentication Information
steps.description: Enter authentication information for Case Management integration

inputs.description: Label for this integration instance.
inputs.label: Label

inputs.description: Define variables here to templatize integration connections and actions. For example, you can use https://www.{{hostname}}.com, where hostname is a variable defined in this input.
inputs.label: Reference Values

inputs.description: Select option to verify connecting server's SSL certificate (Default is Verify SSL Certificate)
inputs.label: Verify SSL

inputs.description: URL of your Logichub instance. Eg: https://xyz.logichub.com (Default to connect to the local LogicHub server using https://nginx:8443)
inputs.label: URL

inputs.description: API Token for accessing Case Management
inputs.label: API Token

actions.name: Search Issues (deprecated)
actions.description: Search issues. Uses older APIs, no longer under maintenance.

inputs.description: Jinja2 template for search text. Leave empty to get all cases. For advanced query see help: https://help.logichub.com/docs/advanced-case-search
inputs.label: Filter Query

inputs.description: Explode each result in a separate row. (default: No)
inputs.label: Explode Results

inputs.description: Limit number of search results to (Default is 10,000 cases)
inputs.label: Limit Search Results

inputs.description: Time to wait between consecutive API requests in milliseconds (Default is 0 millisecond)
inputs.label: Time between consecutive API requests (in millis)

inputs.description: Timeout in seconds (Default is 120 seconds)
inputs.label: Action Timeout

inputs.description: Number of rows to read from parent table
inputs.label: Rows to Process

inputs.description: Count of threads to use for processing rows of input table (Default is 1 thread)
inputs.label: Count of threads

actions.name: Create Case
actions.description: Creates a case with parameters provided.

steps.name: Create Case
steps.description: Creates a case with parameters provided.

inputs.description: Jinja2 template for case type. e.g. This is {{case_type_column_name}}
inputs.label: Case Type Template

inputs.description: Jinja2 template for case title. e.g. This is {{case_title_column_name}}
inputs.label: Case Title Template

inputs.description:
Markdown template for case description (Blockquotes and HTML tags are not supported). e.g. **Reporter**: {{reporter_column_name}}. 
 **Severity**: {{score_column_name}}
inputs.label: Case Description Template

inputs.description: Column name from parent table containing Reporter of the Case
inputs.label: Case Reporter

inputs.description: Column name from parent table containing Status of the Case
inputs.label: Case Assignee

inputs.description: Column name from parent table containing Priority for the Case
inputs.label: Case Priority

inputs.description: Jinja2 template for other case fields. Input is expected in valid json as given in example, for "field-name1" which is a text field and "field-name2" which is a multi-valued field input would look like this: {"field-name1":"{{column1}}", "field-name2":["{{column2}}", "another_value"]}.
inputs.label: Other Case Fields Template

inputs.description: Time to wait between consecutive API requests in milliseconds (Default is 0 millisecond)
inputs.label: Time between consecutive API requests (in millis)

inputs.description: Timeout in seconds (Default is 120 seconds)
inputs.label: Action Timeout

inputs.description: Number of rows to read from parent table
inputs.label: Rows to Process

inputs.description: Count of threads to use for processing rows of input table (Default is 1 thread)
inputs.label: Count of threads

inputs.label: Case Id

inputs.label: Fetch case history

inputs.label: Time between consecutive API requests (in millis)

failedAttempt.errorMessage: This imported connection is using a different version of the Case Management (logichub.case_management) integration than what is currently available on this deployment. Please edit the connection to ensure it works correctly.
